result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.15 (1st). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.15 (1st) was dismissed by the court.

  • Adrian J Guerrero was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $350.00 PLUS all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge, cash bail to apply.

Restitution of $2,118.00 to Isabelle N.. Restitution to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision in case 15CF4359. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Credit for 3 days.
Concurrent with: case 15CF4359, Count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian J Guerrero

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant regarding DOC deductions.
Transcript GUILTY PLEA & SENTENCING, commencing MAY 12, 2016, received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF4359 (30 Pages).
Restitution Refund Packet
Victim Impact Statement filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court ordered defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 1 in 15CF4359, with credit for 3 days time served.  

- Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $350.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge, cash bail to apply.  
-Restitution of $2118.00 to Isabelle N.; Restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision in Case # 15CF4359.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
- Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 18 months.    
- Court orders Ignition Interlock Device for 12 months.

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
             Pretrial Credit

Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Adrian J Guerrero in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
 
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2 and 3: Pursuant to negotiations and upon Motion of the State, Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant GUILTY and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.
